author: sky.cactus
content: People are making claims that the Infura/Coinbase outage was a chain split between upgraded clients and unupgraded clients.  Does anyone have any additional details on whether that is true or not?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: https://forkmon.ethdevops.io/ There was a consensus bug fixed in geth v.1.9.18. All lower clients seems to be affected. Please upgrade your node regularly.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Additionally there will be another release of geth tomorrow that fixes some critical issues: https://twitter.com/go_ethereum/status/1326448260949684228

author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm, the release notes for 1.9.18 don't imply that there was a consensus bugfix included.

author: sky.cactus
content: Perhaps this was intentional at the time to reduce the chance of someone exploiting the issue before people had a chance to upgrade?  If so, was there a follow-up announcement at a later date letting people know they need to upgrade?

author: hudsonjameson
content: <@301186049323958275>, <@211091239112671234> elaborates on your question more in this thread: https://twitter.com/mhswende/status/1326474816736677888?s=19

author: sky.cactus
content: I agree with <@!211091239112671234> that consensus issues shouldn't be publicly announced immediately, we should first quietly patch and wait for people to update.  However, I disagree with the timeline that is proposed of "maybe we'll tell the world about the details in some future presentation".

author: sky.cactus
content: I think the flow that I would *like* to see is to silently patch, and then `n` time later (well defined, but in a range so people cannot pinpoint the fix) it would be announced that there was a consensus bugfix in a patch `n +/- m` time ago and everyone should update.  Then `o` time after that details of the consensus bug would be published publicly.

author: sky.cactus
content:
For example:
**July**: bug fix
**August, September, or October (randomly selected)**: announce that there was a consensus fix sometime within the last 30 to 90 days.
**December**: announce the details of the bug and the the fix.

author: sky.cactus
content: The idea is to first give opportunity for people to naturally upgrade.  Then give people a warning to upgrade that still buys them time (doesn't reveal specifics immediately).  Then finally do an official announcement.
